file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 29-10-10-04 - RETURN FILTER BY-PASS VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL RETURN FILTER BY-PASS VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the return-filter by-pass valve. B. There is one return-filter by-pass valve installed in each hydraulic manifold. The removal/ installation procedures are equivalent for them. C. You can get access to the return-filter by-pass valve of system 1 through access panel 193BL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). D. You can get access to the return-filter by-pass valve of system 2 through access panel 193CR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). E. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY RETURN FILTER BY-PASS VALVE - RE- ALL 29-10-10-000-801-A MOVAL RETURN-FILTER BY-PASS VALVE - IN- ALL 29-10-10-400-801-A STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 29-10-10 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 29-10-10-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. RETURN FILTER BY-PASS VALVE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the return-filter by-pass valve. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 193 193BL Hydraulic compartment of system 1 193 193CR Hydraulic compartment of system 2 D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the hands 1 available Fluid-Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles, Phosphate Ester- Protection for the eyes 1 available Base, Fluid-Resistant Commercially To collect the hydraulic fluid when you dis- Drip Pan 1 available connect the hydraulic line F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Hydraulic compartment of system 1 and 1 Does the task system 2 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 29-10-10 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the ELEC PUMP 1 and (or) ELEC PUMP 2 circuit breaker(s) and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it (them). (2) Fully release the pressure from the related hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (3) Remove access panel 193BL and (or) 193CR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A WARNING:THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM CONTAINS PHOSPHATE-ESTER HYDRAULIC FLUID. THE FLUID CAN CAUSE IRRITATION IN YOUR SKIN OR INJURY TO YOUR EYES. USE THE APPLICABLE GOGGLES AND RUBBER GLOVES. IF THE FLUID TOUCHES YOU, FLUSH YOUR SKIN WITH WATER. IF IT GETS IN YOUR EYES, FLUSH THEM WITH WATER AND GET MEDICAL HELP. (1) Remove the bypass valve assembly (1) from the filter manifold. (2) Remove and discard the O-ring (2) and backups (3) from the bypass valve assembly (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 29-10-10 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 29-10-10-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. RETURN-FILTER BY-PASS VALVE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the return-filter by-pass valve. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200 HTS AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-803-A/200 HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - BLEED OF AIR IPC 29-10-07 MANIFOLD C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 193 193BL Hydraulic compartment of system 1 193 193CR Hydraulic compartment of system 2 D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the hands 1 available Fluid-Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles, Phosphate Ester- Protection for the eyes 1 available Base, Fluid-Resistant F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) O-ring IPC 29-10-07 1/LRU Backup IPC 29-10-07 2/LRU H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Hydraulic compartment of system 2 and 1 Does the task system 1 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 29-10-10 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the O-ring (2) and backups (3) on the bypass valve assembly (1). (2) Install the bypass valve assembly (1) in the filter manifold and torque to 3.4 to 4.5 N.m (30 to 40 lb.in). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the ELEC PUMP 1 and (or) ELEC PUMP 2 circuit breaker(s) and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it (them). (2) Pressurize the related hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200) and make sure that there are no leaks in the return-filter by-pass valve. (3) Bleed the air from the hydraulic system lines ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-803-A/200). (4) Install access panel 193BL and (or) 193CR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 29-10-10 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
